full_summary:
===============

### Tender Notice: Snow Removal Services for Goose Bay, NL

#### Solicitation #30003158

#### Publication Date: December 8, 2022

#### Tender Closing Date: January 6, 2023, 2:00 PM (AST)

The Fisheries and Oceans Canada department invites bids for the provision of Snow Removal Services in Goose Bay, NL.

### Description of Work

The selected contractor will be responsible for providing labor, materials, and equipment to clear snow and ice from the following areas:

* Department of Fisheries and Oceans facility
* Goose Bay MCTS Center
* Various driveways and parking areas

The scope of work includes:

* Removing snow and ice to prevent slippery conditions
* Supplying and spreading salt to prevent slippery conditions
* De-icing and sanding operations as required
* Installing markers to identify locations of catch basins, storm sewers, manholes, etc.
* Removing snow from driveways and parking areas, causing no damage to structures

### Period of Contract

The contract period will commence on the date of award and will continue until December 31, 2023, with an option to extend for a maximum of three (3) one-year terms.

### Trade Agreements

The requirement is subject to various trade agreements, including:

* Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement (CCFTA)
* Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement
* Canada-Peru Free Trade Agreement (CPFTA)
* Canada-Panama Free Trade Agreement
* Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement (CKFTA)
* Canada-Honduras Free Trade Agreement
* Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)

### Contracting Authority

The contract authority for this solicitation is Martin Larocque. Inquiries may be directed to Martin.Larocque@dfo-mpo.gc.ca or phone (819) 454-2077.

### Documents

Bid documents must be obtained from Buyandsell.gc.ca and may be submitted in either official language. The Crown reserves the right to negotiate with any supplier on this procurement.

### Additional Information

Bid openings will be held on January 6, 2023, at 2:00 PM (AST), in Room [insert room number].

### Contact Information

For additional information or clarification, please contact Martin Larocque at Martin.Larocque@dfo-mpo.gc.ca or (819) 454-2077.
